name: Ch.12ABaseConvo3
_source: speak;Natasha;Lady Tethys...|I've been meaning to speak with you.
speak;Tethys;Sister Natasha!|What a pleasant surprise.|I was just taking a moment to rest between performances.
speak;Natasha;I hope I'm not disturbing you.|I wanted to thank you for what you did yesterday.
speak;Tethys;Yesterday?|Oh, you mean dancing for the wounded soldiers?
speak;Natasha;Yes.|The change in their spirits was remarkable!|Even those with the gravest injuries seemed to find new strength.
speak;Tethys;That's very kind of you to say, but...|It's nothing compared to what you do with your healing staves.
speak;Natasha;That's not true at all.|Healing comes in many forms, Lady Tethys.|My staves may mend flesh and bone...|But your dancing mends the heart.
speak;Tethys;I've never thought of it that way before.|Do you really believe that?
speak;Natasha;I do.|I've studied healing arts my whole life in service to the Everlasting.|And I've learned that true recovery requires more than just physical healing.

speak;Tethys;That's a beautiful perspective! I'm glad my dancing does as much for others as it does for me!|Though, sometimes I wish I could do more...|My brother Ewan has such talent for magic, but I never had the gift.
speak;Natasha;We each have our own gifts.|The question is how we use them to help others.
speak;Moulder;Ah, there you are, Sister Natasha.|Oh, and Lady Tethys as well.|What a fortuitous meeting.
speak;Moulder;We've received word that more wounded are arriving from the eastern front.|I fear we'll need all hands available.
speak;Tethys;I should probably leave you to your work, then.
speak;Moulder;Actually, Lady Tethys...|Your presence would be most welcome as well.|Many of the soldiers have been speaking of your performances.|How they give them something to hope for.
speak;Natasha;Perhaps this is an opportunity, Lady Tethys.|Would you consider joining us?|We could work together - healing both body and spirit.
speak;Tethys;I would be honored.|Sister Natasha, might I ask something of you in return?
speak;Tethys;Would you be willing to teach me some of your healing techniques?|Not the magic, perhaps, but the words of comfort, the gentle touch...|The kindness you show to every patient.
speak;Natasha;I would be delighted.|And perhaps you could show me how you bring such joy through movement?|I fear I'm rather stiff in comparison.
speak;Tethys;It would be my pleasure!|We'll learn from each other.
speak;Moulder;It warms my heart to see such collaboration.|Now, shall we?
speak;Natasha;We should go.|The wounded will be arriving soon.
speak;Tethys;Together then!|Two different paths of healing, joined as one.
